FuncDef: The issu abort command aborts an ISSU.
Examples: Warning: The upgrade operation will be aborted, and the system will reboot to old version. Continue?
Warning: Aborting, please wait for a moment...
Warning: The system will reboot caused by abort action.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The issu abort command aborts an ISSU. The issu abort command can be executed to abort an ISSU only when rollback-timer is specified in the issu start command and the issu start phase is over (you can run the display issu state command to check it, and the issu start is finished).
Configuration Impact
The issu abort command can be executed only after rollback-timer is specified in the issu start command and before the issu confirm command. After the issu abort command is executed, the system will roll back to the old version and clear all temporary files of the new version.
Precautions
Services will be interrupted if the entire device is restarted after the ISSU is aborted. The old version is used after the restart.
After the issu confirm command is executed, the issu abort command cannot be used to abort the ISSU.
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
